What is the error message - upload an image ?

  • In Thunderbird
  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section

content: I guess the file names your phone defaults to have changed. Thunderbird uses the file name that the sender specifies. It does not make it up.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I have no idea what mailspring has or had. Thunderbird however has two "combined" inboxes and has done for many years. (over 100 version numbers in fact)

Initially it has a global inbox which incorporated all mail for POP account into a single global inbox under the local folders account. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unify-your-pop-email-accounts-global-inbox

Later, in the Thunderbird version 3 timeframe a unified inbox came along. which is discussed on the products home page https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/

There is support documentation on the unified inbox here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/switching-folder-pane-view
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thenk you Matt! I am using the unified inbox and I am a happy camper.

creator: rrambrose

content:
Try adding exclusions in Windows Defender for the TB executable and the TB Profiles folder: 

- in Windows, click Start and type: virus 
- click Virus & threat protection System settings > Virus & threat protection settings > Manage settings 
- scroll down to Exclusions > click 'Add an exclusion' > File 
- navigate to and select the Thunderbird.exe file (usually in C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird folder) > click 'Open' 
 - to locate the executable:  
 - TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information 
 - Application Basics section > 'Application Binary' 
- click 'Add an exclusion' > Folder 
- navigate to and select the Thunderbird Profiles folder (all profiles - usually at C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles) > click 'Select Folder' 
   - to locate the Profiles folder: 
 - TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information  
 - Application Basics section > scroll down to 'Profile folder > click the 'Open Folder' button 
 - navigate up two levels  
IMPORTANT: go to TB menu > Settings > Privacy & Security > Security > Antivirus and enable 'Allow antivirus clients to quarantine individual incoming messages'.
creator: siffemoz

content:
Session data is auto stored and therefore always opens on whatever account you were viewing at the time prior to exiting. Simple answer is to select the gmail account prior to exiting. A one click solution.

There was an addon called Manually Sort Folders which did have an option to set up a specific on start select account folder, but it does not seem to have been updated recently.

I did check on my version to see if I could set the desktop Thunderbird shortcut to open on a specific folder url, but it does not work. The info was here: https://kb.mozillazine.org/Show_Inbox_when_starting_Thunderbird https://kb.mozillazine.org/Folder_URIs

Url can be found in the 'prefs.js' file or looking in the Confid Editor.

For some weird reason, it just ends up opening two Thunderbird windows and neither are set on the specified account and folder.

But on another of their pages I found you can't specify the URL for a folder, only for a specific message, which is not exactly desired. https://kb.mozillazine.org/Command_line_arguments_-_Thunderbird 

So, at the moment, I have come to a dead end.
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: juergen65

content:
This is how I've always done it. It preserves your whole existing setup. Make sure you install 128.11.0esr on the new PC

1. Launch Thunderbird on the old PC

2. Go to Thunderbird menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

3. Click the Application Basics > Profile Folder 'Open Folder' button

4. The profile folder will open; navigate three levels up to the Roaming folder

5. Close TB, then copy the Thunderbird folder to a flash drive

6. Go to the new PC's Roaming folder as instructed above and delete the Thunderbird folder

7. Paste the Thunderbird folder from the flash drive to the new PC

8. Launch Thunderbird
creator: siffemoz

content: If Thunderbird was unable to retrieve your mail provider, you have the alternate option to configure manually. You will need to check with your provider for their specific email settings. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/manual-account-configuration
creator: christ1

content:
U had beter eerst kunnen proberen of Thunderbird werkte zonder de profielmap terug te plaatsen; de upgrade naar Release kan enkele bestanden wijzigen, waardoor Thunderbird de 'oude' bestanden in het teruggeplaatste deel mogelijk niet kan lezen. Ik denk dat de beste manier om weer toegang te krijgen het volledig verwijderen van TB is (bewaar wel de kopie van uw profiel!), daarna ESR te installeren, uw oude profielmap uit de kopie terug te halen door ESR te vertellen dit te gebruiken en daarna de upgrade nog eens uit te voeren. Het is prima om uit voorzorg een reservekopie te maken, maar de upgrade zou alles in goede banen moeten leiden. Lees voor meer info:

  • Thunderbird Release
  • Profielbeheerder – Thunderbird-profielen aanmaken en verwijderen
  • Instellingen en gegevens importeren in Thunderbird
  • Gebruikersgegevens herstellen die na een Thunderbird-update zijn verdwenen
creator: markh2

content:
A quando risale l'ultimo backup? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content:
You must use --allow-downgrade parameter for the first startup, to override downgrade protection.

Open a command prompt window in the application binary directory and run thunderbird.exe --allow-downgrade
creator: christ1

content:
Hello,

I may have misinterpreted something, but I just tried your suggestion, and first got this error:

C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird>thunderbird.exe --allow-downgrade Access is denied.

followed by a flag that said "This APP Cannot Run On Your PC."

Next, I tried again, after removing the ".exe" after "Thunderbird" so my command became:

C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird>thunderbird --allow-downgrade Access is denied.

and then the same flag saying "This APP Cannot Run On Your PC."

content:
Perhaps the tags are stored in the local .msf file instead of on the IMAP server, so that Folder Repair (which rebuilds the .msf) eliminates the tags. If your server doesn't support keywords, it might be advisable to use custom folders instead of tags for sorting mail.

https://kb.mozillazine.org/Tags#IMAP

content:
I've never seen this before. Google AI suggests ...

The "SEC_ERROR_OCSP_FUTURE_RESPONSE" error in Firefox, Thunderbird, or other Mozilla-based applications typically indicates a problem with your system's date and time settings. The error occurs because the browser is trying to verify a website's certificate using Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP), and the system clock is set to a time before the certificate's validity period.
creator: wsmwk

So really I do not see it as relevant at all at this time.

content:
1. Right click on any column heading above your list of messages.
  2. Select "Read status". This will add a column to your list.
  3. Left click on the column heading above the new, "Read status" column.

After one click, your unread messages will be either at the top of the list or the bottom. If they are not at the top, left click on the column heading again. The unread messages will be at the top.
